    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        
          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

          </button>

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);

        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;

        }

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

          }

            position: static;
          }

            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1100851: division by zero at chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_strip_layout.cc:49
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1100851: division by zero at chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_strip_layout.cc:49
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      prada...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3744612589" title="prada...@gmail.com"><!---->prada...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      prada...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->prada...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

            on

        I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org

        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

This result<span class="line"><!---->notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure

          display: block;

      </style>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          width: 24em;

          flex-grow: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <div id="message"><!---->
          <b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.
          <!----></div>

true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_ubsan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_ubsan = true<!----></span><br>2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<span class="line"><!---->2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<!----></span><br><br>I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<span class="line"><!---->I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went         I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1100851#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1100851#c17">Comment 17<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 1, 2021, 3:18 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

This result<span class="line"><!---->notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"       <style>

option]<!----></span><br>is_debug = false<span class="line"><!---->is_debug = false<!----></span><br>enable_nacl = false<span class="line"><!---->enable_nacl = false<!----></span><br>is_asan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_ubsan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_ubsan = true<!----></span><br>2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<span class="line"><!---->2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<!----></span><br><br>I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<span class="line"><!---->I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>The ubsan log.<span class="line"><!---->The ubsan log.<!----></span><br><br>../../chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_strip_layout.cc:49:41: runtime error: division by zero<span class="line"><!---->../../chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_strip_layout.cc:49:41: runtime error: division by zero<!----></span><br><br>Thread 1 "chrome" hit Breakpoint 1, ~ScopedReport () at file or directory.<span class="line"><!---->389	/b/s/w/ir/cache/builder/src/third_party/llvm/compiler-rt/lib/ubsan/ubsan_diag.cpp: No such file or directory.<!----></span><br>(gdb) bt<span         I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

This result<span class="line"><!---->notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" Steps to reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Raising priority as I'm hitting this issue when trying to reproduce clusterfuzz bugs elsewhere. minimum_width` below is 0):<span class="line"><!---->I added some logs to where this is happening (note: `crossover_width - minimum_width` below is 0):<!----></span><br><br>      if (width < crossover_width) {<span class="line"><!---->      if (width &lt; crossover_width) {<!----></span><br>        domain = LayoutDomain::kInactiveWidthBelowActiveWidth;<span class="line"><!---->        domain = LayoutDomain::kInactiveWidthBelowActiveWidth;<!----></span><br>+       fprintf(stderr, "width (valid? %d): %d, minimum_width: %f, crossover_width: %f\n",<span class="line"><!---->+       fprintf(stderr, "width (valid? %d): %d, minimum_width: %f, crossover_width: %f\n",<!----></span><br>+               width.has_value(), width.value_or(-12345678), minimum_width, crossover_width);<span class="line"><!---->+               width.has_value(), width.value_or(-12345678), minimum_width, crossover_width);<!----></span><br>        space_fraction_available =<span class="line"><!---->        space_fraction_available =<!----></span><br>            (width.value() -         I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe.           Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599"><!---->74d60d0e50ec2e23d6926ce5284b3d2c24399599<!----></a><br>Author: Taylor Bergquist <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Taylor Bergquist &lt;<!----></span>tbergquist@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tbergquist@chromium.org"><!---->tbergquist@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Nov 03 20:24:23 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Nov 03 20:24:23 2021<!----></span><br><br>Fix divide by zero in tabstrip layout calculations.<span class="line"><!---->Fix divide by zero in tabstrip layout calculations.<!----></span><br><br>This would only happen when there was only one tab, but<span class="line"><!---->This would only happen when there was only one tab, but<!----></span><br>there wasn't enough space in the tabstrip for that tab -<span class="line"><!---->there wasn't enough space in the tabstrip for that tab -<!----></span><br>notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<span class="line"><!---->notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1100851" title="division by zero at chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_strip_layout.cc:49"><!---->Bug: 1100851<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I5637452bf7da781534ab0457bc876d47a02081ab<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I5637452bf7da781534ab0457bc876d47a02081ab<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: true<span class="line"><!---->is_asan = true<!----></span><br>is_ubsan = true<span class="line"><!---->is_ubsan = true<!----></span><br>2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<span class="line"><!---->2. run chrome  (e.g. ./chrome)<!----></span><br><br>I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<span class="line"><!---->I don't know why but, there is a division by zero without any input.<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went         I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

This result<span class="line"><!---->notably during startup of a new session/window. This result<!----></span><br>was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<span class="line"><!---->was always replaced by a subsequent layout with a non-zero<!----></span><br>tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<span class="line"><!---->tabstrip width, and so caused no visual issues.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1100851<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<span class="line"><!---->I've sent the repro to Clusterfuzz but to the ASAN bot since the UBSAN bot is not as safe against malicious POCs. The POC is quite enormous so I can't claim it's safe. As such I don't really expect this to repro on the ASAN bot... but given we're being handed a repro .html document for this bug, it seems exploitable from the open web and marking this Critical/P0 as a result.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We commit ourselves to a 30 day deadline for fixing for critical severity vulnerabilities, and have exceeded it here. If you're unable to look into this soon, could you please find another owner or remove yourself so that this gets back into the security triage queue?<span class="line"><!---->We commit ourselves to a 30 day deadline for fixing for critical severity vulnerabilities, and have exceeded it here. If you're unable to look into this soon, could you please find another owner or remove yourself so that this gets back into the security triage queue?<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      <div class="issue-diff">

          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          danakj@chromium.org

        From the description in <span class="line"><!---->From the description in <!----></span>issue 1264157<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1264157" title="Security: division by zero in CalculateSpaceFractionAvailable"><!---->issue 1264157<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<span class="line"><!---->this seems like a UB in the browser process with no UI interaction required. These are very unusual. tbergqiust@ please could you jump on this?<!----></span><br><br>In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<span class="line"><!---->In theory, the UB of the divide-by-zero could result in arbitrary exploitable badness occurring in the browser process. In practice I expect it's probably just that the contents of the result is undefined. That value is clamped using base::clamp which _might_ clean up the value. But it might not. By definition it's undefined behavior. I think we have to assume this is indeed Critical severity until or unless it can be proven that there are no exploitable effects.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
